p: A recent German report states that it seems to be well distinguishable from a post-infectious olfactory disorder following rhinitis or another upper respiratory tract infection: most of the patients describe a rather sudden, almost complete loss of odour (i.e. mostly anosmia, less often hyposmia). COVID-19 patients are less likely to have other nasal symptoms such as nasal breathing obstruction, clinically manifest rhinitis or excessive nasal secretions [ 48].
